minor.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: small and not very important or serious, especially when compared with other things
minor.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: We have made some minor changes to the program.
They played only a minor role in local government.
He escaped with only minor injuries.
minor.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: based on a particular type of musical scale
minor.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Mahler’s Symphony No. 3 in D minor
minor.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: someone who is below the age at which they become legally responsible for their actions
minor.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: This film contains material unsuitable for minors.
minor.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: the second main subject that you study at university for your degree
minor.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: I’m taking history as my minor.
minor.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: someone who is below the age at which they become legally responsible for their actions
minor.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The bank does not normally lend to minors.
minor.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: The cost of the bid will have only a minor impact on full-year results.
